sense.name: 60 seconds, or else a very short period of time
sense.commentary: MINUTE[+measure][+time][+small][+unit/+estimate] Note: a span or extend of time, not just a single point (sense 2)
sense.examples: You should bake the pudding for 50 minutes at 325 Fahrenheit. The cat will snatch that fish off the table in a New York minute. Just wait a minute and I'll go with you for coffee. The sky looks ready to open up any minute now. (soon) My watch is running three minutes fast.

sense.name: a single point in time
sense.commentary: MINUTE[+event][+punctual][+temporal] Note: focus is on a starting point or a juncture, not a span or extent of time (sense 1)
sense.examples: I'll let you know the minute he gets here. From the minute Sally got home until bedtime the children didn't stop quarreling. She had been laughing one minute and crying the next.

sense.name: a measure of angular distance
sense.commentary: MINUTE[+measure][+distance][+angular] Note: a measurement of arcs and angles
sense.examples: This angle measures 32 degrees, nine minutes and twelve seconds. These two stars are calculated to be one arc minute apart.

sense.name: memoranda, records of a meeting
sense.examples: Mary read through issues from the last meeting in the minute book. Who will keep the minutes for our meeting today?

sense.name: a linear distance expressed in time
sense.commentary: MINUTE[+measure][+distance][+calculation][+temporal] Note: talking about a linear distance in terms of how long it takes to get there
sense.examples: The hotel is situated only ten minutes from the beach. The bus stop is only a three-minute walk from here. We're still about forty minutes outside New York. (flying to NYC)
